snippet: Some people in search of serenity are trying to abstain from looking at their reflections for a day, a week, a month or even a year.
abstract: Growing number of Americans in search of serenity are abstaining from looking at their reflections for a day, a week, a month or even a year; those who have engaged in these so-called mirror fasts say not looking at their reflections has allowed them to focus on more important issues like work and relationships.
lead_paragraph: Some people in search of serenity are trying to abstain from looking at their reflections for a day, a week, a month or even a year.

headline.seo: ‘Mirror Fasts’ Help Take the Focus Off Yourself
